jobPostingInfo.title: Engineering Graduate Student, II-2
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

This summer intern will be a member of a team developing power converters for long-distance tether power systems, enabling extreme-terrain robotic missions throughout our solar system. Tethered systems provide the enabling power and communications for rovers to explore craters, slopes, cliffs, and caves on planetary bodies, with numerous upcoming missions dependent on their use. Our challenge is developing a high voltage power conversion and transmission system that can efficiently power rovers over long distances on the Lunar, Martian, and other planetary surfaces. As a member of our team, you will participate in design, simulation, analysis, and test of high voltage, multilevel, power converters to provide the fundamental building blocks of the transmission system.

What it takes:

  • Must be able to work 40 hours per week during the summer of 2023.
  • Must be able to work on-site at JPL and perform hands-on measurements with photovoltaics
  • Must be currently enrolled in a college or university pursuing a masters or PhD in electrical engineering, physics, applied physics, aerospace engineering, or a related technical discipline.
  • Must be enrolled full time in school for the following the fall term.
  • Must have a minimum cumulative 3.0 out of a 4.0 GPA
  • Knowledge in one or more of the following areas: power systems, power electronics, analog electronics
  • Recently completed coursework providing an understanding and application of power generation, power conversion, semiconductor devices, electrical measurements, laboratory practices

What would help:

  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Relevant internship experience
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities
  • Experience in power electronics design, simulation, and test
  • Experience in printed circuit board design, fabrication, and assembly  
  • Experience in magnetics design and simulation

The typical hourly rate for this job in Pasadena, California depending on education level is $19 as a freshman, $22 as a sophomore, $26 as a junior, $29 as a senior

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
